newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani rupee closes up in kerb, seen steady.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani rupee closes up in kerb, seen steady.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed 0.30 up at 41.85 to the dollar in the kerb market on Saturday on an increased supply of the U.S. currency and a liquidity crunch for speculators, dealers said.

"The dollar supply had increased last month on a sudden rise in demand on fears of devaluation of the rupee," dealer Owais Kalia said. "But now the dollar demand has died down and the rupee bounced back." The central bank rate, last fixed on May 23, was 40.3900/40.5920 to the dollar. The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed down at 3.70 from the previous close of 4.10. -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192
